summary: This document is a comprehensive evidence report and case summary compilation for multiple FBI investigations related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes detailed inventories of evidence items (1A, 1B, 1C, 1D types), serialized reports, and summaries for cases 50D-NY-3027571 (Child Sex Trafficking), 72-MM-113327 (Obstruction of Justice - Alfredo Rodriguez), 31E-MM-108062 (Child Prostitution), 90A-NY-3151227 (Epstein Death Investigation), 90C-NY-3154599 (MCC Contraband), and 9A-NY-3144791 (Threats to Victim). The document reveals the extensive scope of evidence collected, including digital media, financial records, photographs, and physical items from properties like Little Saint James and 9 East 71st Street.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Primary subject of child sex trafficking investigation; indicted on 07/02/2019, arrested on 07/06/2019, died by suicide in jail on 08/10/2019. His properties and assets were searched.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-conspirator in child sex trafficking; indicted on 06/29/2020, arrested on 07/02/2020, convicted on 12/29/2021, sentenced to 20 years on 06/28/2022.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Subject of obstruction of justice case (72-MM-113327); arrested 12/08/2009 for trying to sell a black address book containing information on Epstein's associates; convicted and sentenced in 2010.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Received correspondence from an attorney regarding the Epstein case, as noted in a serial report.

connections.description: Maxwell was Epstein's longtime associate, indicted and convicted for her role in his child sex trafficking operation.
Rodriguez was a former employee (butler) of Epstein who was convicted for obstruction of justice for trying to sell an Epstein address book.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on child sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), ruled a suicide.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on charges related to her involvement in Epstein's sex trafficking operation.

events.title: Conviction of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was convicted on 5 out of 6 counts related to sex trafficking.

events.title: Sentencing of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was sentenced to 20 years in prison.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution - Little Saint James
events.description: FBI executed a search warrant on Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, seizing extensive evidence including computers, hard drives, photographs, and other items.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution - 9 East 71st Street
events.description: FBI executed a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence, seizing evidence including computers, financial documents, and other items.

events.title: Arrest of Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former butler, was arrested for obstruction of justice for attempting to sell an Epstein address book.

locations: Little Saint James Island (US Virgin Islands)
9 East 71st Street, New York, New York 10021
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, NY
keyFacts: The FBI's Child Sex Trafficking investigation (50D-NY-3027571) into Jeffrey Epstein was opened on December 8, 2018, and remained in 'Pending Inactive' status as of the document's compilation.

Extensive evidence was seized from Epstein's properties, including over 180 '1B' type evidence items (computers, hard drives, servers, storage media, photographs, financial documents, and unusual items like massage tables, busts, and sex toys) from Little Saint James and his New York residence.

A separate death investigation (90A-NY-3151227) was opened after Epstein's suicide, leading to the indictment of two correctional officers for false records and conspiracy; they entered a deferred prosecution agreement in May 2021.

An earlier Florida case (31E-MM-108062) from 2006 involved child prostitution allegations against Epstein, resulting in a state guilty plea, with evidence later incorporated into the New York investigation.
The document contains hundreds of redacted interview and proffer titles, indicating a vast number of witnesses, victims, and associates were interviewed by the FBI throughout the investigation.
